attributes.action: acknowledge the true scale of homelessness in  this country and put into place an adequate framework of locally determined policies to deal with it.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The problem of rough sleeping or sofa surfing which is effecting many more young people today is one that has long since dropped off the governement radar. With the drive toward the elimination of perceived anti social behaviour many homeless individuals with severe social problems are being excluded from main stream living rather than being allowed access to its treatments and benefits. This exclusion creates an environement where the homeless become the vulnerable members of society and are open to explotation that in most cases is hidden from the general public. With this problem continuing to grow despite rhetoric to the contrary we feel that the impetus for any real change has been or is at least in the process of being lost. If there is any desire within the governement for real change that is based on both quality and quantity then we should welcome any sign that those who are at the sharp end of the development work are consulted rather than those who have very little if any contact with the reality of homelessness as it presents itself on our streets. The 21st century should be all about inclusion rather than the ever present exclusion that is still evident in our society.
